Getting back on track to finding the eevee, he was found quite a lot of clues to the direction it was going. Finding himself quite the detective every time he found some paw prints in mud, some broken twigs or a piece of fur stuck to a thorn. It took him about a quarter of an hour before he finally had caught up, though he probably wouldn't have if it weren't for the pokemon taking a break at a small stream.

Trying to keep a low profile he takes a better look, the eevee still seems freaked out, its ears twitching all over the place for every little sound and looking up every few seconds after taking a sip. Now that he took a careful look it seemed hurt somehow and beaten up, nothing his new healing touch couldn't handle, but it was interesting imagining how it had happened.

As Damon decided to make his move and approach, both he and the eevee heard some wood, seemingly wheels, close in. Before either could react though a carriage, or rather a person in a wheelbarrow with a scizor pulling it forward at top speed, came crashing through the trees.

The man inside got launched onto the pokemons back and took a minute to recover, already having noticed the eevee was to surprised to suddenly turn around and sprint away. He wore a black uniform, boots, pants, jumper even a cap and gloves. Most notably an R was present on the chest, though as far as Damon knew, rocket didn't have a known branch in Shino. Maybe he was just a wannabe?

"There you are... you miserable runt! As long as we're here, I've been put in charge of looking after you and you escape the moment, I open your cage in an open area." The person said, as he stepped closer. "What's this? Your wounded? What's up with that huh!? You know how much we put into you, our little star and now you're telling me you gave it to something else?"

He dashed forward and kicked the eevee, seeming quite angry at it and putting enough force behind the kick to send it scraping along the ground for a few meters. "You were supposed to be a host until we got the trade off, remaking the strain inside you will cut the profit in half." He said, as he jumped forward ready to kick the poor guy again.

"Yeah and it looks like one of them is being turn into a pokemon" said Damon. "That is one of them. The other is healing other humans or pokemon" said the grunt.

131321121121.title: Everyone deserves a second chance...

1313211211211.content:
Several minutes later some results began getting translated from the data and the grunt looked up to Damon.

"Yeah, the strain is indeed mutating, it should have never gone over to a human." The grunt said, as he and all the scientists left the room and came back wearing hazard suits. "Don't worry this is all for our own protection, you're the source, so there's no need to protect you from anything." The grunt said.

"So what's the current situation?" Damon asked, feeling not quite calmed down by that notion though and starting to get annoyed at the hooked up machinery around him.

"As you've guessed changing fully into a pokemon is one of the things you can expect to happen anywhere between now and a day. It having been tailored for pokemon to begin with, You'll be faster stronger and tougher than the normal of your kind, but will experience aggressive impulses. No data on how those will get triggered though. Second and last from what we can currently tell, the healing ability your carrying is changing into an infectious form, in other words you'll emit the strain and give it to the humans around you. Who'll become carriers and once the incubation period is done, will experience the same symptoms as you." The grunt explains, Damon kind of amazed a how they had found all of that out in such a short time.

"We're doomed. We haven't found a cure for your current situation" Damon lower his ears after hearing that there was no cure.

He begins to look around and find the room to be empty. He then heard a voice and found and intercom in the room.

"This will be your new home until we find a cure. It's a bit empty. But it's better to keep you in here and away from Team Rocket. We can't let them capture you and use you for their plan"

Damon starts to like his Eevee form. But he does miss his family and friends. Later that night. Damon was asleep as the scientist and the grunt checks on him.

As the night goes on.

Movement could be seen through the clothes as a little Eevee pops out of it. Damon had been change into a Eevee and got out of his clothes. He look over his new body and couldn't believe he had been change into a pokemon after being bitten and scratch by one.

"...uuh, I'm fine. How did this happen?" Damon asks, amazed at hearing his own voice. It wasn't like it had been before and even though he knew what he had said. He couldn't help but shake the feeling, that he had said it by just repeating his species name.

Damon quickly dodges and was surprise by his new speed. He thinks the changes might have made him faster.

"I could still have battles as a pokemon" said Damon. "Aren't you mad?" He ask. "A little. But I do understand. You only did it because you were scared. You only want to protect yourself" said Damon. "Do you forgive me then?" said Eevee.

After a small trip through the undergrowth of the forest, they arrived at a more rocky and less flat area. Not far anymore, was what eevee had said to Damon upon arriving at this shift in terrain and just like eevee had said, they come across a small opening in the rocks of a large hill. Damon would have walked past it, if eevee hadn't stopped him again, it being hidden in between some shrubbery.

"I'll go in first." Eevee said, more or less so Damon wouldn't miss the hole. The cave he entered was quite spacious, though to small for most larger pokemon to live in comfortably. A small bed, or something that resembled one was build on top of a higher plateau, build out of dried grass and fur. Light in the cave was made through illuminated moss, though it wasn't as bright as a lamp or even a candle, the sun coming through the entrance helped a lot as well.

"I'm sorry, I wasn't expecting any guests or family, so I only have one bed." Eevee said, his ears hanging low for a second seemingly in regret.

"Quite the cozy place, do all wild pokemon have spots like this?" Damon asked, being quite curious.

"It varies, some live in trees, others in rivers, in holes in the ground or in caves and so on. Some just sleep in plain sight. Some get captured and a lucky finder takes its place." Eevee replied. "Anything else you'd want to know right away?"

Eevee lower it's ears once more. "Well I am sorry Damon. I didn't mean to change you into my own species. I got scared when you grab me" said Eevee. "It's alright Eevee. But why were you scared?" He ask. "I guess I should tell you everything then"

152.content:
Damon eagerly ran to the Cinnabar Island lab. Today he would finally be allowed to start his journey as a Pokemon trainer. Unlike most kids his age, however, he wouldn't be receiving it from a parent or professor.

No, he had found a fossil while on a camping trip with his dad, and he fully intended to get it revived here to be his first Pokemon. He didn't know what it was, but most fossil Pokemon grew to be very strong, so he figured he couldn't go wrong with one.

He reached the front desk, and asked where the fossil revival machine was.

"Fossil revival machine is mine." The man behind the desk said with a strange accent. "Works goodly, it does. I help you with revival. You want come back and watch? Or stay here wait?" Damon looked around. Other than one fairly familiar face, Damon really couldn't see anything of interest in the lobby.

He eventually decided...
152.title: Cinnabar Labs.

1521.content:
Damon, figuring he had nothing better to do while waiting for the regeneration, followed the man to the back room. A large machine with two chambers sat against the wall, connected to an otherwise ordinary looking computer.

"Set fossil in little chamber please." Damon did as he said.

"Sir," Damon asked, "do you know what type of fossil this is?"

The man Looked at his computer as the machine whirred to life. "Ah, yes." The man said. "Fossil is from..."

(Sorry to make more "choose" chapters.)

15211.content: "Is from Kanto." Said the man. "Is specifically..."

152112.content:
"Is Areodactyl, specifically." The man said, quite impressed. "You got much good find. Now watch." The machine's smaller chamber began to whir as it carefully scanned the fossil.

"Phase one complete." The computer displayed after about thirty long minutes. "Beginning phase two." The second, larger chamber began to buzz, before stopping a few seconds later. "ERROR: matter/energy conversion tube removed. Please repair before continuing."

"Oh no!" The man groaned. "Little boy, I sorry to ask, but take hammer and slam tube back in place, please."

"Alright." Damon sighed, taking the hammer and heading into the big chamber. Immediately, he saw the bent tube, and, with some percussive maintenance, fixed it. But right after he did, the door to the second chamber slammed shut, and the machine buzzed to life again. The man ran to the front of the machine, desperately trying to open the door, but it wouldn't budge.

Meanwhile Damon started to feel strange. He was becoming...
152112.title: Routine Aerodactyl Revival.

choices: Try to tell the scientist what happened.
1521121.content:
A strange energy arced through Damon, and he felt his muscles ache and grow under his skin. His hair was receding, as all over his skin, tough, gray scales began to grow out, covering his body.

Damon screeched as his skeleton began to rearrange. His spine seemed to go every which-way, as his neck elongated, and a long, thick tail grew out behind him at same time, ripping his pants. His legs thickened with muscle to support his growing frame, as his torso barreled out, straining his shirt.

Damon groaned as he felt his jaws stretch out, growing more teeth as his current teeth sharpened. His eyes turned green, and two horns grew from the back of his head.

Lastly, his end fingers grew quite long, a membrane appearing under them and his arms, forming his new wings, splitting the remains of his shirt.

He panted in pain, naked and in a strange new form.

Then the door opened...
1521121.title: The prehistoric power flies again!

At first, Damon was a little slow, as he wasn't used to floating like mew did, but he started catching up with Mew once he had got the hang of it. After following her for about 5 minutes, the two mews had finally arrived at a small, remote cave where Damon assumed was where Mew lived. "Here we are, this is my home." Mew cheerfully said, as she invited Damon to her house. It was surprisingly spacious, it was nearly as big as Damon's old home. There was a small dining room near to the caves entrance with a seemingly natural wooden table and chairs. Beyond the dining room was a living room with an old couch and loads of random artefacts. To the right of the dining room was a large fireplace which Damon thought was the kitchen. Beyond the living room there was a large flat rock which Mew used for a bed.

"So make yourself at home until you are your usual self." Mew told Damon. "I'm sure that you will recover from your amnesia soon."

And that's when it hit Damon. He remembered that Mew was obvlibious to the fact that he was transformed into a mew. "Mew, I've got to tell you something, I don't really have amnesia"

1523.content:
Damon sat in the waiting room, staring at the wall in boredom. There were a bunch of magazines on the table, but all of them were a few steps above his grade level in science at best.

He looked over to the only other person in the room. He was slightly chubby, and wore a pair of large, nerdy-looking glasses. Damon couldn't shake the feeling that he had seen him before, but he just couldn't remember where.

As Damon sifted through the magazines again, he found his answer. On the cover of Fame Checker was Bill, the most famous Pokemanic in Kanto. Now he know where he had seen this guy.

Damon jumped out of his seat and approached him. "Hey, you're that guy I saw on TV, Bill the Pokemanic! It's nice to meet you!"

"It is?" Bill said Damon interrupting his train of thought. "Oh right, nice to meet you...?"

"Damon." Damon said. "So what are you doing here Bill? Did you come here to revive a fossil too?"

"No." Bill cleared his throat. "Actually, I came here to show someone a new invention of mine. You see, when I invented the box system, it was a huge success. Naturally, I wanted to try and repeat it, so I tried to make a similar system to help teleport humans over longer distances then the teleporters currently made by the Sliph co."

"I head about that." Damon said. "So you made it?"

"Yes... and no, at the same time." Bill admitted. "You see, when I made the system it didn't work as planned, and it turned me into a Clefairy for quite a while, until I met a trainer who was willing to help me reverse the process."

"You turned into a Clefairy?" Damon giggled.

"Yes." Bill sighed. "But after the trainer helped me work the telporter again, I changed back to normal. But I realized that while my machine didn't make a good teleporter, it could bring something to revolutionize how we study and interact with Pokemon.

He continued. "Imagine, being able to live as a Pokemon to understand how these creatures live more closely than we ever have before. That's why I came here. I figured I might find someone who would be willing to spend a moth or two as a Pokemon to study them."

"Wow." Damon said in awe.

"Say..." Bill rubbed his chin in thought, "Would you like to give it a try? I'd need both you and your parents permission, but If you agree, for the month you spend as a Pokemon I'll keep you on my ranch, designed to keep Pokemon of every type health and happy, with all the food, water, and shelter you'll need. Plus I'll pay both you and your parents a hefty sum after it's all over.

"And just to sweeten the deal, if you make friends with one of the Pokemon on my ranch I'll let you keep him or her for your Pokemon journey once you're human again." He inhaled before finishing. "So, what do you say?"
1523.title: He fits the Bill.

choices: Damon is fine with being a Ponyta.

15513.content:
Damon gazed in awe of the massive chamber, featuring countless Pokemon statues on pedestals around the room. On the floor near the entrance, written in letters of the Unown, was the phrase: "Those who wish to change nothing will never find the true purpose of this room."

Wondering what that was supposed to mean, Damon walked further in. He remembered seeing a documentary of how the archeologists who unearthed this place discovered hidden rooms under each statue by radar. However, due their inability to move the statues, or break through the floor, nobody could reach them. Eventually, years passed, and the exploration team gave up hope of advancing any further.

Damon let out his starter Pokemon, his Turtwig, Buddy, to walk alongside him. Buddy was quite happy to be with Damon, and seemed very curious about the room. He hesitantly touched a Ponyta statue. Both he and Damon were quite shocked when the room rumbled as the statue pulled back, revealing a hole in the floor.

"Woah!" Damon shouted. "Buddy..." He said more calmly. "I think we've just come closer to solving an ancient mystery than any grown ups have ever tried." He carefully approached the hole in the floor. But as he did, a strange force seemed to start pulling him and Buddy into it. Damon desperately grabbed hold of the ledge, trying to fight the pull. Buddy started falling down the hole, but quickly bite onto Damon's leg in a desperate attempt to climb out. But he only succeeded in dragging Damon down with him.

They fell for what felt like hours, before landing softly on the ground.

"Where are we?" Buddy asked. Damon gasped.

"Buddy? Did you just talk?"

"Hey! I did, didn't I?" Buddy said in shock.

"There is nothing unusual about that. In this place, there are no true forms or languages." A female voice said.

"Who said that?" Damon shuddered.

A ghost Pokemon that seemed to be wear a witch's hat, a Mismagius appeared before them. "I did." She stated. "I must say, it's been a long time since we've had a Pokemon Trainer come down here."

"What is 'here?'" Buddy asked.

"This," The Mismagius said, "is where, in the days of old, humans and Pokemon would trade skins, and learn to see the world through a new pair of eyes. I was called Madame Metamorphosis, once, but I prefer the name May."

"Wait, what do you mean by switching skins?" Buddy asked.

"I could, if you wish, change you both." May said with a grin. "You, Turtwig, could become a human, or any other Pokemon, if you wished, while you, young human could live as long as you liked as a Pokemon. And any time you came back here, either of you could change your species again, or go back to the way you were before."

"You mean, I could see what it's like to be human, then come back and be a Turtwig again?" Buddy asked?

"Indeed." May said. "In fact you and your trainer agree, you could be the trainer, and he the Pokemon for a time, if you like."

"That sounds kinda fun!" Damon said excitedly. "Let's try it, Buddy!"

"I'll do it!" Buddy nodded.

"Well then..." May grinned, "what species do you wish to be human? At the moment, we are in the Ponyta room, so that is what you would be if cast the spell now. Is that to your liking, or should we resurface, and use a different statue's room?"
15513.title: The Chamber of Companions.

choices: Find some wild Pokemon to fight or catch.
Go to town and participate in a Pokemon competition of some kind.
155131.content:
"I don't mind." Damon said. "I'd love to try being any Pokemon!"

"Okay then." May says. "Now, you'll need to take off your clothes. And Turtwig, once you become human, you'll need to put them on."

"Why?" Buddy asked as Damon started undressing.

"You'll understand once you're human." May assured him. "Now, human, let's get you changed." She started chanting.

Short, tan fur grew all over Damon's body. His hands and feet shifted into black hooves. "This feels really weir- wei- whineey!" Damon's last word was lost to a whinny as his vocal chords changed, however, the magic quickly translated them back into English. "But it's kind of fun too!" Damon added, before his mouth and nose extended into a snout.

Damon's eye turned big and black, while his ears became triangular. Damon felt a sudden shift in his hips, forcing him into a quadruped position. Lastly, a mane and a tail made of fire jetted out from Damon. "Awesome!" Damon cried.

Buddy, meanwhile grew taller, his legs growing longer, his from legs becoming arms with fingers, his twig fading into his head as he started to walk upright. He started to feel a bit self-conscious so he slipped on Damon's clothes as his hair grew in. "Cool!" He shouted. "So this is what it's like to be tall."

"I'm glad you both enjoy it." May said. "I'm giving the former human a spell that will his new trainer to understand him, and the new trainer will continue to be able to understand Pokemon speech as well."

"Thank you!" Damon and Buddy said at the same time.

May smiled. "I'll teleport you out of here now. Remember, if you ever want to try a new form, or want your old bodies back, just come back here."

And with that, Damon and Buddy were teleported outside the ruin's entrance.

"So," Buddy asked, "what do we do now?"
155131.title: Switching roles.

"Let's go look for some wild Pokemon." Damon suggested. "Route 202 is a good place to start."

Buddy nodded. "Yeah, we'll have to take that path to get back to Twinleaf Town anyway." The two friends walked side by side for a quite a while before coming to a patch of tall grass. Damon cautiously stepped into it, when something bumped into his leg.

"Oof..." The Zigzagoon sputtered. "What'd I hit?"

"A Zigzagoon?" Buddy was a bit surprised. "I thought they couldn't be found in Sinnoh?"

"I heard they migrate through here sometimes!" Damon said. "We can't miss this chance to get one! Get a Pokeball from my bag, quick!"

"Gotcha!" Buddy said, digging through Damon's bag.

"Wait, that human can understand you-OOF!" The Zigzagoon grunted as Damon tackled him.

"Pokeball, go!" Buddy tossed a Pokeball at the Zigzagoon, which turned into energy inside the Pokeball. It wiggled once, twice, three times, then clicked closed.

"Alright!" Damon cheered. "We got a Zigzgoon!"

"Let's name him Zippy!" Buddy suggested.

"That's fine." Damon said. "That was pretty easy."

"Well, Zigzagoon are pretty weak." Buddy noted. "It won't be this easy for most other Pokemon."

155222122222222121111111111321.content:
"Okay today's lesson is also in two parts, I'm going to introduce you to alternate types of spell casting and have you try a standard counter spell, Dispel." The three of you nodding. "I'll want you to work on the alternate spell casting, but don't worry if you want to try the spell with the wand, as this is an introduction to it. Incantation, Focus, Rune, and Flow, are four common types. Incantation relies on a specific phrase to cast a spell, Though since you are pokemon I wouldn't suggest trying this. Focus is much more common, wands are a kind of focus, To use focus you need to channel all your will to magical spot or object then it casts the spell, This would be most beneficial for you Lisa, Your third eye is a perfect medium for focus, though don't try casting spells with just yet. Rune, relies on images that invoke the hidden magic of the universe that is ever present, This tends to have a downfall of having time to set it up usualy, Damona this style would be best suited to you because of your illusions. And lastly Flow, tapping directly into the magic in the universe and using body motion and will to channel and direct it, This would be best for you Erica." The magician Explains.

"Dispel is easy, and very useful, It simply dispels magical energy. I'll levitate those three rocks over there, you try to cast dispel to get them to fall, It is very useful if a spell starts to get out of control, though it does have limits to what it can do. The main Idea is to wipe the slate clean to start fresh." The magician goes into detail of how to cast Dispel.

"Okay now, time to practice."

"I knew that my amulet had magic. You can sense that kind of stuff when your a pokémage." Prince Damon finished with a grin.

"Your a mage, like with real magic." Damon asked excitedly.

"Yes of course. Our family line is very magical. I'm a fire-type mage... well an apprentice mage to be exact. I'm still in training." Prince Damon kindly replied. Then his thoughts returned back to the amulet. "It is curious about the amulet though. Transformation spells, like what our amulets were charmed with, usually only work with one individual. Complications arise if there are more people."

"Complications? What kind of complications?" Worry was obvious in Damon's voice

"Don't worry; it looks like nothing wrong happened to us. The transformation reversed itself; we're human and not some kind of pokémon-human hybrid." Prince Damon reassured his descendant. But then a sudden realization hit him. His body. He could not feel all of his body. Half of it felt like it was missing. He couldn't see it through the murky water, so he hadn't realized it until now.

The same thoughts were running through Damon's mind. Including the fact that their heads were awfully close to on another. Both Damons looked at each other, scared. Damon brought his right hand to the right half of his chest, just underneath his neck. The clothes he felt were foreign. It wasn't the same shirt he had been wearing a few minutes ago. He slowly slide his hand across his chest until he passed what should have been the center of his chest. Feeling abruptly ended as he passed the direct middle, and Prince Damon shuddered. "You can feel my hand...?" Prince Damon just nodded in response. "I think there was a complication?"

As if to answer that question. The murky water cleared as the dirt settled back down. It was obvious that the two Damons now shared a single body bellow their necks. Their clothes were an odd blend of the clothing they had been wearing previously. Hanging directly in front of their joined chests was a single amulet. There was no crack or any indication that the amulet had ever been in two pieces. "Yes..." Prince Damon replied, stunned that his voice was still steady. "...there was defiantly a complication."
15522222212.title: A complication

"We better get to work then" said the prince. "And fast" said Damon.
155222222121.title: The two Damons have trouble adjusting to their ...

choices: The Damons head to the Library as suggested
1552222221212.content:
"WIZARD!!!" A loud and authoritarian voice boomed.

The Prince and Damon shared a fearful glance. "Oh no, its my dad, the King. We can't let him see us like this." Scared out of their minds, any sort of coordination the two had developed in their short time bound together was quickly lost. Prince Damon frantically tried direct them to hide underneath the table cloth while Damon tried to hide behind the curtains of the window. Their body leaned back and forth as the two sides each Damon controlled battled to pull the other. Inevitably, the Damons tripped on each other and collapsed face-first into the hard stone floor.

The wizard stifled a laugh. "Just stand and look natural you two." he said while helping them back to their feet. Damon heard him whisper a phrase under his breathe. It was strange, like a very old english or something. What was even weirder was that he could understand some of the words he whispered in this old language. The Wizard finished the last words of his spell, and his bright blue eyes glowed faintly. And not a moment too soon.

The King rudely pushed the door to the Wizard's chamber wide open. "Wizard, why did you not speak when I called?"

"Sorry sire, I was busy entertaining the young prince." The wizard calmly replied. Both Damons stared at the wizard in shock.

"Oh, sorry son. I did not see you there." The king smiled toward the Damons before turning back to the Wizard. "At least I know where one of my sons are now. Anyways, I am in need of your assistance Wizard. Can you prepare a strong sleeping draft? The queen and I both have had trouble these past few nights."

"Of course, your highness. I will brew it, and have it delivered to your chambers before nightfall."

The King, looking pleased, turned on his heal and left down the corridor. His boots echoing through the hall.

Both Damons turned to the wizard and spoke at once, "What did you do?"

He responded with a smile. "Just a simple spell to hide your... attachment issue. When people look at you, they will only see one of you. This will allow you to go out and not fear being seen. But, be careful when speaking. The spell does not hide sound."

Damon looked towards his counterpart. "Well, I guess that's one less thing we have to worry about."

"Wizard, do you have any idea where we should begin to figure out how to separate ourselves?" the Prince asked.

"I might. What if we traveled back to the future. The book I was reading must have some answers about this." Damon answered.

"Absolutely not." The wizard stated. "It is far too dangerous, especially in your condition. You, Damon, were lucky to not be destroyed instantly when you cast that spell. Time-travel is dangerous, and no one knows how time works exactly."

"What do you mean?" Both Damons asked.

"Time is... complicated. Prince Damon, if you had read the book I gave you for your studies, then you would know. But, I will briefly explain. There are three theories to how time-travel works. First, time travel is impossible, but we already know that to be false. Second, time-travel will change nothing. You coming back to this time was supposed to happen; the future and past are interconnected. One supports the other. This however is pish-posh in my opinion. I believe that time travel works more closely to the third theory. This is where time-travel is possible, and time is changeable. So therefore, you coming back has changed the future, so the future you cam from, Damon, no longer exists. This is now a alternate time-line."

"You mean, I messed things up by coming back here. I destroyed the time I came from?" Damon was not pleased to hear that. He felt terrible.

"No, you didn't destroy it. Your original time still does exist, but it is now impossible for you to return. Think of it as a worm tunneling through the dirt. You came back to an earlier part of the tunnel, and now you are going up a different path, a new path. But anyways, we can argue theories of time later. You two have far more important things to worry about now. To answer your early question, Prince Damon; I would suggest going to the court library. I would go with you to help, but I have to start on this sleeping draft if I am to keep my position as Court Wizard." With that, the wizard turned and started collecting supplies from his potions cupboard.

The two Damons, slowly and carefully walked out of the Wizard's chambers and into the hallway. Their merged body was still so new to them, walking and many other efforts would take much time to re-learn. Hopefully, they wouldn't need to though. "Alright" the prince turned to his other half. "Do you think we should take a trip to the Library?"

Damon giggled a bit at the mention of going to the library. The prince looked at him funny, so he explained. "Its just that this all started because I took a trip to the library. Now this part of the adventure might end back in the library. Its ironic." Then a thought occurred to Damon, "Did the court wizard really mean to teach you how to grow a second head later?"

The prince smiled, "No, he was just joking, and understandably shocked by our appearance. But maybe when this is all done, we can learn magic from the wizard together. I really do want to know what type of magic you have."

"You think I have magic?" Damon asked confused.

"Of course, all members of the royal family have some affinity to magic. Even my dad, the king does. But he is terrible at it; hence why we have a court wizard. But, it should be obvious that you have magic. How else were you able to come back here and end up stuck to me." The prince smiled.

Damon smiled back. "Well, I never thought of it that way. Maybe I do have magic. Now I am curious about what type I am too." Reality of their situation sunk back in though. "Though, we need to fix our current predicament first. Why don't you lead the way. I will follow wherever you think we should go, not that I have much choice in the matter."

The prince lightly padded the spot where their necks joined the same shoulders. "Well hopefully, you will have a choice in the matter soon." Suddenly, their form shifted again between a two-headed pokemon and back to their human form. "That is our cue to get back on track to solving this." The boys then headed off down the corridor, hugging the walls for balance.

15522222212122.title: Aaron runs into the Damons

155222222121221.content:
Prince Damon began to close the book, before Damon intervined by placing his hand over the page they were reading from. "Hold on Prince... something isn't right about this page."

The Prince ran his hand along the pages. "Yes... they fell like paper."

Damon gave him an annoyed glare. "Funny. No, this page is thicker than the rest, and the writing abruptly ends. There is more about our amulet here, I know it." Damon flipped the page back and forth, trying to see if more pages were stuck. "Help me with this will you?" Damon asked, a little irritated with only having one arm to work with. Prince Damon reach over and tried helping his counterpart see if the pages were stuck together. They weren't. "Man, I thought for sure that had to be something more here."

"Wait" the prince said, a little louder than he had intended.

"Is everything alright my lord..." the librarian asked as he appeared between two shelves. "I thought I heard you talking with someone." The man's eyes scanned the area Damon and the prince were in. The wizards spell was still holding, despite their quick transformation earlier.

"No, sorry I disturbed you. I was just speaking aloud, trying to figure... actually, I could use your help." the Prince finally said. Damon gave him a shocked look; the prince stared him back. He tried telling him, through his eyes, not to worry and follow along. The prince turned back to the librarian, "I need help with this book. It seems that there is a hidden page, but I can't get to it." The prince tried to pick up the book, but it was too heavy and awkward to move by just himself. He looked at Damon's hand, just resting on the table, and then he looked to Damon. Seeming to get the message, Damon grabbed ahold of the other side of the book, and helped the prince hand the book to the librarian.

The librarian took a few moments to look at the pages, turning them back and forth, and scanning through them. "Doing some light reading for your magic studies?" the librarian asked to which the prince just nodded. "Well, many of the books written in this time do have hidden passages in them. Like here, you can see that the author has an unfinished thoughts about these Zoroak brothers." He waved one of his hands over the book, saying a few lines in the old language. The pages of the book glowed faintly, and the book seemed to then get thicker. "There, I have... unlocked the pages you wanted." The librarian handed the book back to them, and noticed the medallion. He face suddenly became fearful, before he masked it with an obvious fake smile. "If that is all my lord, I have books to reorganize." He gave a quick bow, and disappeared through the shelves.

Damon and the prince shared a confused glance. "That was weird." The prince pointed out.

"Let's not worry about that now. Here are the missing pages we needed." Damon responded. He and the prince positioned their body over the book so they could both read together. Their four eyes bounced across the pages, reading each word carefully.

They found that the book indeed had more information to offer. It went deeper into the history, explaining why this all occured. Long ago, the medallions jewelry owned by two twin princes. They had charmed their medallions with the power to transform them into Zoroaks. The crown princess, their elder sister, despised the brothers. She was afraid that they had the eye on her throne, which she was correct in assuming. The brothers had tried to murder her in her sleep as the Zoroaks they could become. As an accomplished witch, the princess used her powers to banish the brothers through time. By accident, her spell misfired. She accidentally sent them 80 years into the future, with no way to return. In addition, her spell accidentally cursed the brothers to remain in their pokemon forms. The Zoroak brothers decided to take their revenge on the grandchildren of their sister, the current king and his family.

The Damons were astonished at how evil sounding these brothers were. As they continued reading, they finally got to the part about the medallions. If they were ever brought back together, the books explained that the wearer would be instantly destroyed and replaced with the powerful two-headed Zoroak twins. "Wait... " Damon interrupted their reading. "Why weren't we instantly destroyed by the twins' return?"

The prince was quick to answer; his face loosing color. "Its because there were two of us. The medallions were only meant to be worn by one person... not two. Because we both wore them..."

"Because we both wore them what? What does it mean?" Damon said, pressing him for an answer. If could feel Prince Damon's fear running through their body and into him. His veins felt cold as ice.

"It means that it gave us a fighting chance to figure out a way to stop them from returning... but it also means... it also means that we probably won't have separate bodies again." The prince Damon said. "The wearer was 'instantly destroyed'... or in our case, part of each of us was destroyed. The body we now share... is all we have left."

Damon felt like he had been punched in the stomach. Or, at least half of his stomach. Damon swallowed hard. He was frightened about what the prince had concluded, but... "We can't worry about that now." Damon said, surprised that his voice stayed steady. "We need to stop the twins from returning. We need to save your kingdom."

"Its not my kingdom!" the prince yelled. "Aaron is the crown prince. It will be his a soon as our father dies."

Damon debated telling the prince what he knew. Finally, he said, "Prince... Damon... you will rule the kingdom. I read it in the book that brought me here. You, Damon, become king."

"Oh yeah" The prince glared at Damon, "and what you read is meaningless now. You changed things by coming here. Your future is gone now... remember what the wizard said. Time is not set on the pages of a book. You changed things. And I helped." The prince looked defeated as he slammed his head on the table in font of them.

Damon forced them to sit straight back up, to try and have a normal conversation. "What do you mean? I'm sorry if I changed things. But we can try to change them back."

"No, you don't understand." the prince insisted. "Didn't you ever wonder how one simple magical phrase could bring you back here. You may have magic, but you have no practice with it. On your own... that would be impossible. I helped you."

There was a long minute of silence between them. "I have a gift." The prince finally admitted. "I have a gift in divination, seeing possible futures. I knew that in all of the possible futures I wouldn't become king, and I could see my brother ruining everything. So, I decided to make a drastic change. I... I wrote the book you read with my brother Brendan's help. I wrote the spell you read into it." He looked at Damon apologetically. "You read half of the spell needed to go through time. I used the other half to make a bridge, to change things drastically. For a long time, no one ever came through the bridge. So, I decided to channel my spell through the medallion."

Damon looked at the prince. He could sense what he did. "The medallions strengthened the bridge because they were linked despite the distance of time."

"Yes" the prince answered. "I swear I didn't know anything else about the medallions besides that. I would never put you or the kingdom in jeopardy. I'm sorry. I caused this to happen. I caused us to be joined like we are. I didn't realize it until now.... I'm so sorry."

Damon wasn't angry with the prince, enough though he thought that he should be. He grabbed his other half by his shoulder, trying to comfort him. "Look, you don't have sole blame for this. I read that spell, even if I didn't know what I was doing. I wanted to learn about my past. Being joined... not exactly how I wanted to learn about my ancestors, but at least I have a front row seat. And that wasn't your fault anyway. You couldn't have know that the medallions house evil twins looking for revenge." Damon smiled, trying to loosen the situation. "We will fix this. You wanted to make a better future, well I will try and help. I was an orphan in the future. I had not future there, but maybe in the past I do. Even if we remain attached... we'll find a way to deal with it. Look at the bright side, there are two of us in one... we can get double the girls." The joke finally brought a smile to his other half's face. "But first... we need to stop the twins."

The prince, feeling more confident, answered strongly, "You're right. Thank you for helping me. We need to stop the twins." An aura of confidence surrounded him. "We need to destroy the medallion. Destroying them will destroy the twins."

After getting his pokemon and all of his stuff. Damon get's on the boat and heads to the Island. A few minuets later. Damon makes it, to the Island, and see many pokemon roaming around the Island.

He heads to the hotel and spots a beautiful Ninetales standing in his way. "Whoa a Ninetales and a beautiful one as well. I should catch it"

Damon was about to take out one of his pokemon. But the Ninetales stops him with her tail. "Sorry human we have a rule here on Ninetales Island. No catching other pokemon.

Damon was stun. The Ninetales can talk. "Y-you can talk?" he ask. Ninetales smile. "Yes me, and other Ninetales, had learn to speak your language" said Ninetales.

"That's pretty cool. What do you say this place was again?" said Damon. "Ninetales Island. It use to be a home for all Vulpix and Ninetales. Until we decided to make a private resort and invite human trainers and their pokemon to come to our beloved home. When a trainer comes, to the Island, they can experience what it's like to be a pokemon" said Ninetales.

"What do you mean?" Damon ask. "We Ninetales have the power to change humans into pokemon if they want. Tell me young human. Would you like to become a pokemon yourself and enjoy your stay here on the Island?" She ask.

"Can you change me back into a human if I want to?" he ask. "But of course. If you ever want to go back, being a human, ask me or the other Ninetales on the Island" said Ninetales.

"Then sure I want to be a pokemon" Damon said excitedly. "Excellent. What is your name then young human?" Ninetales ask him.

"Damon. Do you have a name?" Damon replied. "I do. My name is Ember" "Nice to meet you then Ember" said Damon.

"You too. Now take off your clothes. You won't be needing it when your changes are finish" Damon nods and takes off his clothes.

"Good. Now that's all settle and done with. What pokemon do you want to be change into?" Ember ask. Damon thinks about it and decided to become a.
15522222222221.title: To the Island

15522222222222.content: Does he head to a Mage school where they teach magic and transformation?
15522222222222.title: Other

choices: A bunch of students finds and changes them
155222222222221.content:
Damon had been offer to go to a mage school where they teach magic and transformations. He got excited and decided to head there.

When he got there. He was greeted by the school's head master. "Welcome you must be Damon. We have been waiting for you. Come with me and I'll show your around"

The head master then begins to show Damon around the school as Damon see's other mage's practicing their magic and transformations. Damon was in awe.

"As you can see Damon. We here at the magic teaches gifted trainer the fine arts of magic" The head master said to Damon.

"You really think I'm gifted? I'm not sure about that" said Damon. "Of course your gifted Damon. You just don't know it yet. If you accept. We can teach you everything about using magic" said the head master.

"Will I get my own pokemon too?" Damon. "You will and you can choose whatever pokemon you want as your partner. I'll make sure that you get one"

One of the students then goes up to them. "Head master. I'm glad I found you" said the student. "Ah Magninus. Damon this is Magninus. He is one of our top students here. What seems to be the problem?" he ask.

"There's a fight going on in the main courtyard" said Magninus. "Again? Alright I'll try to stop them. Magninus why don't you show Damon around while I'll go stop the fight"

The head master then left. "You must be new here. I'm Magninus" said Magninus. "Nice to meet you. I'm Damon" Damon replied back.

"So are you going to be a student here? It will be nice to make a new friend" said Magninus. "I'm thinking about it. It sure does look like a nice school" said Damon.

"Then let me show you around this place then" Magninus then show's Damon around.
155222222222221.title: Mage school

choices: A group of students find them and transform them
1552222222222211.content:
"This place is amazing..." Damon said, for what must have been the 10th time. Magninus had taken Damon on the grand tour of the school. They had already visited the potions laboratory class, the dueling and pokemon battle field, the infirmary, the green house, and many other rooms. Currently, they were in the transformation classroom. The room was decorated with several moving artworks of various individuals casting pokemon transformation spells on themselves.

Magninus smiled at Damon comment. "Professor Mutatio teaches these classes. She's brilliant."

"I know I've said this a thousand times, but I can't wait to get started here. There's so much to learn!" Damon said gazing at one of the pictures. "Hey Magninus, how long have you been at the school. You don't look much older than I am?"

"I've been here for about three years now. This school takes students as early as 10 years old, but I enrolled when I was 12." Magninus replied.

"So you are as old as I am... but you have already been here for three years." Damon was a little upset. He was way behind this student in terms of skill and knowledge.

"Don't worry about discovering you powers late. Everyone finds there powers at different times, and here, you will learn quickly from the professors. Though, I am interested what house you will be sorted into."

"Huh? What do you mean?" Damon was confused.

"Oh, I thought you knew already. There are 6 houses, each is compressed of three different types of mages. " Magninus said matter-of-factly.

"Types of mages? Like Pokemon types?" Damon scratched an itch on his chin. "I thought mages could do all sorts of magic."

"We can, but there are limits. Every mage falls into a type, like Pokemon. Some mages, like myself and some Pokemon, fall into two types. And also just like Pokemon, each type of mage has strengths, weakness, and unique abilities." Magninus tried to explain it as simply as possible. "Um, for example grass type mages can control plant life and turn into grass type pokemon. Grass type mages have a disadvantage when fighting fire type mages, but an advantage against water type mages."

"Just like the respective Pokemon do. Okay, I understand better. So, a lot of the same rules apply." Damon smiled.

"Exactly." Magninus smiled back.

"So, what type of mage are you? And who is your Pokemon partner?"

"I'm a... you know what. I will let you find out when I learn what type of mage you are during the sorting ceremony tonight." Magninus looked at his watch, and panic washed over his face. "Which is going to start soon. Quick, I'll take you to the main dinning hall!" With that, Magninus rushed off down the corridor with Damon hot on his heel.
1552222222222211.title: Magninus shows Damon the school grounds

choices: They run into other students that change them both
15522222222222111.content:
With in a few minuets. Damon and Magninus had made it to main hall where the sorting ceremony was about to start. There were other trainers waiting to be sorted as well.

"I'm nervous" said Damon. "Don't be. You'll do fine. You'll be fine. I'll see you later Damon" Magninus then goes sit down at a table.

The students were then sorted out one by one. Damon could see they were nervous like him. All the students were sorted into different houses.

Finally it was Damon's turn to be sorted into a house. It only took a few minuets. But he was sorted into a house. He was going to be a grass type mage.

Damon felt excited. Grass type pokemon was one of his favorite type of pokemon. After being sorted Damon sat at the table with the other grass type mages.

After the ceremony was over and eating dinner. Damon and everyone left the dinning room. Magninus then goes up to Damon feeling happy.

"Damon congratulations. Your a grass mage" said Magninus. "Thanks grass type pokemon is one of my favorite types" said Damon.

"I'm so happy for you" said Magninus. "So what kind of mage are you?" Damon ask. "I'm a fire mage" said Magninus.

"Well that means you have the type advantage against me" said Damon. "True but that doesn't mean we can be friends right?" Magninus ask.

"Of course not. I want to be your friend" said Damon. "I'm glad to hear that. There going to take you to your house now. I'll see you later"

Magninus then left with the other fire mages. Damon follow's the grass mages and couldn't wait to start becoming a grass mage.

The next day. Damon wakes up and meets with Magninus. "Morning Damon. Ready to start?" Magninus ask. "Yeah but I could use your help getting to my class's" said Damon.

"Leave it to me. I'll help you out any which way" Magninus then helps Damon with his first day at school
15522222222222111.title: The sorting ceremony

choices: They make it to the grand hall
15522222222222112.content:
But before they could get to the dinning hall. A bunch of students finds the two of them. "Well if it isn't Magninus. How have you been doing Magninus?" one of the students ask.

"Out of my way. I have to take Damon to the coronation ceremony so he can join our school" said Magninus. "Not a chance. We have enough students here already" said the second student.

"You know these students?" Damon ask. "Yes their a bunch of bullies who always pick on me and change me most of the time. There bug mages" said Magninus.

"Exactly and the two of you should be bug types. Hmm let's start with the new kid first. I bet he would like to be a little bug"

Before they could say anything. Damon was hit by one of the mages spells and shrunk into his clothes. "Damon! Your not going to get away with this"

Magninus try to cast a spell. But he was too late as he too got hit, by a spell, and shrinks into his clothes. "That takes care of them. Let's head to the dinning hall"

The bug mages then left. A Caterpie came out of Damon's clothes and a Weedle came out of Magninus clothes. "I didn't expect to be change into a bug pokemon on my first day" said Damon.

"They won't get away with this. This is the third time they change me into a Weedle. We need to tell one of the teachers about this. Come on we have to the grand hall" said Magninus.

"But they change us into the weakest of bug types and were slow as well" said Damon. "Don't worry. I know a quick way to get there. After being change into a Weedle. I've discover many places a bug type pokemon can get too. I found the quickest way to the grand hall. Just follow me and we'll get to your coronation ceremony"

Magninus then leads Damon to the grand hall
15522222222222112.title: A group of students find them and transform them
